text: Hi everybody!

Today I'm going to show you 
how to make easy bulgogi.

If you know about Korean cooking
probably you know about bulgogi.
Marinated beef, cooked.

You guys already know how to make bulgogi 
because I posted a recipe years ago.

But today's recipe is 
very very simple and easy.
I know you guys love the word "easy."

Easy something, easy something
"Hm, what is easy?" (laughs)
But easy doesn't mean not delicious.
This is easy plus delicious.
That's why I'm sharing this recipe.
Shall we start?

By the way, today I'm making this 
marinated beef
and then I'm going to cook it on my patio.

I found out some really delicious way of cooking
and I'm so excited to release this method.
So let's make marinade first.
We need 4 garlic cloves and 2 green onions.
Let's crush these guys.
And green onions.
Happy happy! (laughs)

I have something to tell you, 
probably you guys already noticed this?
This is my logo, my logo is here.
This is a gift from this company.

From Italy! It's made in Italy. I didn't know 
anything about this knife when I bought it.

I have been using it for a long 
time, you guys know that.

Several months ago a person 
from this company contacted me.
"Oh, Maangchi, thank you for using our knife!"
"We'd like to send you some more knives."

I don't need any more knives. So I actually 
refused: "Thank you, it's ok, I still have my knife."
"No problem, I don't need anything else."

And then they asked me again: "Oh, 
how about we can engrave your logo on this knife?"

Oh, wait a minute, my logo is here? 
Sounds cool, doesn't it?
So I told them: "Ok sure!" and then they sent me several knives

I don't think I will use them but large size, long 
size, and even including scissors! (laughs)

So now we are going to use 
soy sauce, sugar, and water.

So 2, 2, 3 remember. (laughs) 
2, 2, 3!
2 tablespoons, soy sauce.
2 tablespoons soy sauce.
And 2 tablespoons sugar.
White or brown, any sugar.
Water, just plain water, 3 tablespoons.
1 tablespoon sesame oil.
Ground black pepper, a half teaspoon.

My usual bulgogi recipe is doesn't use much sugar, 
I use honey or I sometimes use rice syrup

onion and pear, I work 
so hard to make it delicious!

But this recipe I skip all of this 
and "Ok just use 2 tablespoons sugar."
Make my life so easy! (laughs)

So but, you guys don't want to use sugar?
I know some of you are
very sensitive about using sugar.

So just use other stuff: 
honey, rice syrup, or anything sweet.

Some Korean food such as bulgogi, 
japchae, it's supposed to be sweet!
Sesame seeds, about 1 tablespoon.

This is toasted sesame seeds but I didn't grind.
Just use my fingers.

Like this. 
(light grinding sound)

You don't have to grind 
so finely, just coarsely.
So this is nice marinade!
Mix well until the sugar is well well dissolved.
Ok!
Tenderloin! 1 pound filet mignon.
Very very good cut.

Tender.
Tender part.

I just put this in the freezer 
around 1 and a half hours.
So that I can cut, slice very thinly.
Bulgogi should be cut thinly.
So that it all marinates, well together.

It looks like a huge amount, 
but it's only 1 pound.
Let's add to this marinade.
Ok, next!
Use your hand, just mix!

Put this in the refrigerator for 30 
minutes, and then we are ready to cook!

Meanwhile, I can prepare rice, kimchi, we always eat 
with lettuce and ssamjang, these kinds of things.
We never eat bulgogi by itself.
Always serve with rice.
So rice and kimchi and I'm going to prepare

and meanwhile I will keep this in 
the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
(melodic music)
I found out this method recently.

You can pan fry over the stove.
Heated skillet, and then add this marinated beef
and then just cook and eat.
But this method is a new method for me.
This is a a grill that I bought in a Korean grocery store in the kitchenware section.

Sometimes they sell it, sometimes they 
don't sell it, you check it out, you know?
And this is a grill, and the grill has 2 handles.
Between them there is a little bit of a gap.

So you can add some fish or beef, 
marinated beef.

So I will just show you
how to do it.
And...
After cooking, but this on a large platter.
It's really nice looking. And...
You should not burn the beef.

I mean, this burnt meat is 
not good for you health.
So you have to be really careful, and I'm going to cook over medium heat.

And constantly I use my tongs

This is kind of quick cooking.

Let's cook! And this is my gas burner.

So you have to cook evenly.
I cooked one minute, and turn over.
Just lift this grill, like this.
So the heat is here.
So around the corner, cook this all evenly

Like this.

All assorted mushrooms, in

chopped it up and I used this with
